intro: Hieracium integrilingua, commonly known as the broadleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves that are broadly ovate and often hairy. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium integrilingua is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through its rhizomes.
